com.scalar.db.sql

Interface SqlTwoPhaseCommitTransaction

  • All Superinterfaces:
    SqlStatementExecutable

    public interface SqlTwoPhaseCommitTransaction
extends SqlStatementExecutable
    A transaction abstraction for two-phase commit transactions for ScalarDB SQL API.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void abort()
      Aborts a transaction.
      void commit()
      Commits a transaction.
      java.lang.String getId()
      Returns the ID of a transaction.
      void prepare()
      Prepares a transaction.
      void rollback()
      Rolls back a transaction.
      void validate()
      Validates a transaction.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.scalar.db.sql.SqlStatementExecutable

        execute, execute, execute, execute, execute, execute, execute, execute, execute, execute, execute, execute

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        java.lang.String getId()
        Returns the ID of a transaction.
        Returns:
        the ID of a transaction

      • prepare

        void prepare()
        Prepares a transaction.
        Throws:
        TransactionRetryableException - if the transaction fails to prepare due to retryable faults (e.g., a transaction conflict). You can retry the transaction from the beginning.
        SqlException - if the transaction fails to prepare due to transient or nontransient faults. You can try retrying the transaction from the beginning, but the transaction may still fail if the cause is nontranient

      • validate

        void validate()
        Validates a transaction.
        Throws:
        TransactionRetryableException - if the transaction fails to validate due to retryable faults (e.g., a transaction conflict). You can retry the transaction from the beginning.
        SqlException - if the transaction fails to validate due to transient or nontransient faults. You can try retrying the transaction from the beginning, but the transaction may still fail if the cause is nontranient

      • commit

        void commit()
        Commits a transaction.
        Throws:
        TransactionRetryableException - if the transaction fails to commit due to retryable faults (e.g., a transaction conflict). You can retry the transaction from the beginning.
        UnknownTransactionStatusException - if the transaction status (committed or aborted) is unknown
        SqlException - if the transaction fails to commit due to transient or nontransient faults. You can try retrying the transaction from the beginning, but the transaction may still fail if the cause is nontranient

      • rollback

        void rollback()
        Rolls back a transaction.

      • abort

        default void abort()
        Aborts a transaction. This method is an alias of rollback().
